item.title: Ticket #848 (When user is logged in, usenrame is always populated in comment fields) updated
item.dc:creator: Technosailor
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #848 (When user is logged in, usenrame is always populated in comment fields) created
item.dc:creator: Technosailor
item.description:
When a user is logged in, they will automatically have comment fields populated in the comment field.

I know why this is done to make it easier for logged in users to comment, but even when the fields are changed (for instance using Aaron instead of admin), the comment entry does not reflect the change.

Suggestion: Make it possible for users to select a default ID for comments in the user profile page and populate the comment field with THOSE values.

item.description: /archives/%post_id% permalinks break when the user passes a thousand posts because the rewrite rules match that as a year instead of a post ID.

item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #843 (Feature request: author in rss / rss2 feeds?) created
item.dc:creator: lyklev
item.description: For blogs with multiple authors, it is nice to see the author of the article; this can be done by adding the "author" tag and using the "the_author()" function in the "foreach..." loop in wp-rss2.php. Is this a good or a bad idea?

item.title: Ticket #841 (Japanese Characters in Post Title causes IE to not render page) updated
item.dc:creator: tabmoW
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #841 (Japanese Characters in Post Title causes IE to not render page) created
item.dc:creator: tabmoW
item.description:
If a user has switched their copy of IE from autodetect characterset to a specific type then this bug will cause the page not render, in japan it is common for a browser to be manually set to SHIFT JIS as the majority of pages are configured badly.

When viewing a permalink page or static page with a post title in japanese the meta-equiv will present a UTF-8 page declaration AFTER UTF-8 Japanese characters have been sent, IE panics and fails in a very ungraceful manner.

item.title: Ticket #430 (upload: incorrect duplicate name handling) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: This isn't the correct way to go about this; on *nix systems, filenames are case-sensitive. foo.jpg and foo.JPG are different files.

item.title: Ticket #839 (After registering user account, "login" form confuses actual wp-login.php) updated
item.dc:creator: lyklev
item.description: The "login.php" in my patch is a link.

item.title: Ticket #839 (After registering user account, "login" form confuses actual wp-login.php) updated
item.dc:creator: lyklev
item.description:
Patch changed

1) apply the patch in #0000838 to fix password in e-mail bug 2) register as a new user 3) on the next screen upon succesful creation of account (still wp-register.php) press "Login" 4) try to log in using username and password from mail

empty screen is shown

item.title: Ticket #839 (After registering user account, "login" form confuses actual wp-login.php) created
item.dc:creator: lyklev
item.description:
After a new user registers him/herself using wp-register.php the user is presented with a message telling him/her that the password is in the mail (see also bug #0000838, since it does not actually happen).

The user is presented a "Login" button which is to take the user to the login screen. Pressing the button sends data along (it is a form, using POST---why?), which causes the subsequent login using the username and password received in the mail (please see #0000838) to break, and a blank screen is shown (php error).

item.title: Ticket #838 (Registration e-mail does not contain password) updated

item.title: Ticket #838 (Registration e-mail does not contain password) created
item.dc:creator: lyklev
item.description: When users register themselves, they get a confirmation e-mail but the password in the mail is empty.

item.title: Ticket #837 (Sort user list by user_level) updated
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #837 (Sort user list by user_level) updated
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #837 (Sort user list by user_level) created
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description: Current sorting of the user list in users.php ("ORDER BY ID ASC") is contrary to what I would expect: the page feels like it should be sorted by user_level rather than by ID. Suggest that it be sorted by user_level DESC, ID ASC.

item.title: Ticket #836 (Add Latin Extended-A Unicode decompositions to remove_accents()) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #836 (Add Latin Extended-A Unicode decompositions to remove_accents()) created
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Add decompositions for the Latin Extended-A Unicode block to remove_accents(). See the decompositions for Latin-1 Supplement for an example. For each character in Latin Extended-A that has an unaccented Basic Latin character in its canonical decompostion, map the UTF-8 octets for that character to the Basic Latin character. Reference the UCD or employ a character map utility to get the canonical decomposition.

item.title: Ticket #816 (Add 'Spam' option to comment moderation) updated
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description: Patch updated against latest CVS (in which #820 is fixed).
